comment._content: Really no clue as of yet... I believe it is facing southward by the shadows...  I see the train cars and I've been looking near train lines but I have no clue.

comment.author: 73626679@N03
comment._content: My guess is that is a school with the newer style,there is a "ball field" also!

comment.author: 96248370@N07
comment._content: Here is my guess.   This is near Byrd Field, currently known as Richmond International Airport.  The large building in the center would likely have been a new warehouse and/or manufacturing plant.   The pavement surrounding the building appears to be configured for trucking to access the many loading docks and the building seems to have rail access.  The small building center top appears to be a hanger.   The field to the upper right would be the outskirts of the airport.   The baseball field could have been a public field.   As the airport has grown it has transformed the area.

comment.author: 58089365@N04
comment._content: Not much of this picture exists anymore. The building has been demolished and turned into a parking lot and the apartments are gone and are now a vacant lot and a Double Tree Hotel. Lewis Road and Ferncroft Rd intersect at the apartments. 37.510415,-77.340623
